oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Detection of β-lactam antimicrobial residues in the milk of cows treated for mastitis by use of the BetaStar® Plus Assay
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Grooms, D. L.
Norby, B.
Grooms, K. E.
Jagodzinski, E. N.
Erskine, R. J.
Halbert, L. M.
Rice, J. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: rapid assays
antimicrobial residues
immunomigration
β-lactam
commingled milk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rapid assays for on-farm detection of antimicrobial residues in milk collected from individual cows would be advantageous to reduce risks of violative residues in marketed milk. The objective of this project was to evaluate the accuracy of a rapid immunomigration assay (BetaStar® Plus, N eogen Corporation, Lansing, MI) for detecting β-lactam antibiotic residues in milk collected from individual dairy cows treated for mastitis. This assay is currently FDA-approved for detecting β-lactam antibiotic residues in commingled milk.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2013; 231
